channel.title: Lebowski Podcast
channel.description: A monthly podcast where a group of The Big Lebowski fans discuss and explore different aspects of the film. Sometimes guest speakers are brought in to help educate us on some of the finer points of film and culture.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Lebowski Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: A monthly podcast where a group of The Big Lebowski fans discuss and explore different aspects of the film. Sometimes guest speakers are brought in to help educate us on some of the finer points of film and culture.
channel.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
channel.itunes:keywords: The Big Lebowski, Coen Brothers, Film Noir, Dude Abides, Jeff Bridges, movies, theory, festival, dudeism

item.title: Episode 61 - The Past 5 Years of Lebowski Culture
item.description: To kick off our sixth year of podcasting, Liz and Chalupa meet up with Dude Tom and Tim to discuss the past half-decade of Lebowski-dom. Some things have changed a lot and other have just stayed the same. We're changing up our episode frequency, but posting more on the blog.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalupa, Liz, Tim and Tom talking about the past five years of Lebowski fan culture.
item.itunes:summary: To kick off our sixth year of podcasting, Liz and Chalupa meet up with Dude Tom and Tim to discuss the past half-decade of Lebowski-dom. Some things have changed a lot and other have just stayed the same. We're changing up our episode frequency, but posting more on the blog.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big lebowski,dudeism,phil wells,adam bertocci,merchandise,art,facebook,dvd,blu-ray

item.title: Episode 59 - Scavenger Hunt: An Unlikely Union
item.description: Eddie Chung, creator of The Achievers, and Matt Podolsky are working on a new documentary about the California Condor. I had the pleasure of sitting down with Eddie and Matt to briefly talk about their new film before the music became too loud and the crowd rushed in at Lebowski Fest LA 2011.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Eddie Chung and Matt Podolsky about their new documentary film.
item.itunes:summary: Eddie Chung, creator of The Achievers, and Matt Podolsky are working on a new documentary about the California Condor. I had the pleasure of sitting down with Eddie and Matt to briefly talk about their new film before the music became too loud and the crowd rushed in at Lebowski Fest LA 2011.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, dude, fest, LA, 2011, chung, podolsky, condor, documentary, film

item.title: Episode 58 - Oliver, Founder of Dudeism
item.description: After emailing, chatting, writing, and interacting with Oliver Benjamin for a good five years or so, he and I finally sat down for a proper interview. Oliver is the founder of Dudeism and runs Dudespaper, the official web publication of Dudeism.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: After emailing, chatting, writing, and interacting with Oliver Benjamin for a good five years or so, he and I finally sat down for a proper interview. Oliver is the founder of Dudeism and runs Dudespaper, the official web publication of Dudeism.

item.title: Episode 56 - Ron Burgin, the Dude
item.description: First episode in our series of interviews with achievers who not only look like The Dude, but live their lives in a Dude-like fashion. Our first installment features Ron Burgin.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Episode 54 - Prof Tim's Dissertation
item.description: Last summer at the 9th Annual Lebowski Fest (Summer 2010) Prof Tim and I sat down to discuss his Lebowski-centered project and other things surrounding the podcat and The Big Lebowski. We hope you enjoy it. Next episode will be our review of the 10th Annual Lebowski Fest.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Prof Tim's dissertation on The Big Lebowski and other pop culture surrounding the film

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, dude, prof tim, dissertation, pop culture, internet meme

item.title: Episode 53 - A Real Little Lebowski Urban Achiever
item.description: The other day I found an article written by Hayley Rafner. Her father worked as a set director on The Big Lebowski and she's one of the kids in the Little Lebowski Urban Achievers photo hanging on Mr. Lebowski's wall. Obviously we had to interview her.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Hayley Rafner

item.title: Episode 52 - Lebowski Art Part 2
item.description: Here's part two in our art series. This episode features an interview with the amazing Bill Green. He's the dude who does all the posters, t-shirts, and what have you for Lebowski Fest!
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Bill Green, Lebowski Fest artist.

item.title: Episode 51 - Commentary Track
item.description: In 2007 we had the great idea of creating a full length commentary track for The Big Lebowski. The Coens aren't into DVD extras and we still haven't found one on the internet yet. We used the 10th Anniversary copy of the DVD and there are instructions at the beginning to synchronize.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Full length commentary track for The Big Lebowski
item.itunes:summary: In 2007 we had the great idea of creating a full length commentary track for The Big Lebowski. The Coens aren't into DVD extras and we still haven't found one on the internet yet. We used the 10th Anniversary copy of the DVD and there are instructions at the beginning to synchronize.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, dude, pop culture, commentary

item.title: Episode 50 - Lebowski Art Part 1
item.description: This is the first of a two-part series on Lebowski art. If you have not seen a piece of original art themed on The Big Lebowski, then this is the episode for you. If you're looking for a painting, a sculpture, an illustration, or a good web site to browse - you will be able to find what you're looking for. If you know of some other great Lebowski-themed pieces, please let us know and we'll put them on our blog.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalupa and Liz discuss Lebowski art in their home and on the web.
item.itunes:summary: This is the first of a two-part series on Lebowski art. If you have not seen a piece of original art themed on The Big Lebowski, then this is the episode for you. item.title: Episode 49 - Gift Ideas
item.description:
Trying to find a Big Lebowski themed gift for that special lady or dude in your life?  We scoured the internets and created a list of ideas that might just be what you're looking for.

Next month we're going to delve into the choreography of Busby Berkeley whose legacy was imitated during the dream sequence in The Big Lebowski.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalupa and Liz discuss Lebowski gifts available on the internet
item.itunes:summary:

item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, dude, jeff delucia,freud,actors,fame,bowling,LA,roger deakins

item.title: Episode 48 - More chat with Jeff DeLucia
item.description:
Jeff DeLucia and Chalupa had a second phone conversation that turned out better than the first. Many random topics were discussed from how Freud relates to Lebowsk characters, different films Jeff has worked on over the years, Roger Deakins, and how to contact actors. If you like Jeff, be sure to check out Episode 44 - Crew member Jeff DeLucia.
This ends our episodes for 2010. We have some great episodes coming in 2011. Stay tuned for a Valentines gift guide later this month.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Jeff DeLucia and Chalupa talk about different ins and outs regarding The Big Lebowski

item.title: Episode 47 - Dude Sweaters
item.description: Liz and Chalupa recently acquired some "Dude sweaters" and share some tips on how to find one. Later they relate their experience at Viva Lebowski and mention some upcoming episodes.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: How to find a Dude sweater and a re-cap of Viva Lebowski in Portland, ME.

item.title: Episode 46 - Donny's Slice
item.description: After a year of theorizing, we finally sat down and tried out some orange drinks Donny might have enjoyed. Slice isn't available anymore and Crush has taken its place. What's your favorite orange drink?
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Trying out replacements for Donny's favorite drink, Orange Slice.
item.itunes:summary: After a year of theorizing, we finally sat down and tried out some orange drinks Donny might have enjoyed. Slice isn't available anymore and Crush has taken its place. What's your favorite orange drink?

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, donny, steve buscemi,orange,slice,drinks,taste test

item.title: Episode 45 - Reviewing Two Gents of Lebowski
item.description: Adam Bertocci's book, Two Gentlemen of Lebowski, was released today and we give our two cents. We really enjoyed it and think you will too. We're giving away 5 copies next month so be sure to enter our contest!
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Review of Bertocci's Two Gentlemen of Lebowski. Tune in to win a free copy.

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, book, adam bertocci, gentlemen, review

item.title: Episode 44 - Crew Member Jeff DeLucia
item.description: Earlier this summer I had the pleasure of chatting with someone from the crew of The Big Lebowski, Jeff DeLucia. Jeff is a card-holding union member and has been working on the sets of TV shows and films for the past 20 years. Jeff has a lot of interesting things to say about lighting a scene, and great stories from his past jobs. The audio is a little rough on this one. Had some technical difficulties with the recording. The whole interview is available in our member section.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Jeff DeLucia who did pre-production work on the set of The Big Lebowski.

item.title: Episode 43 - Lebowski Studies at Carmichael's
item.description: The day before the 9th Annual Lebowski Fest officially started, there was an event at Carmichael's Bookstore in Louisville for Aaron Jaffe and Ed Comentale's book, The Year's Work in Lebowski Studies.  Ed and Aaron are no strangers to the podcast.  They were our guests back on Episode 15.  Jaffe and Comentale allowed me to record the discussion between them and the audience at the event.  I hope this gives you a good idea of what it was like.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Book event for The Year's Work in Lebowski Studies at Carmichael's Bookstore in Louisville, KY.

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, fest, dude, louisville, book, ed comentale, aaron jaffe, studies

item.title: Episode 42 - 9th Annual Lebowski Fest
item.description: Review of the 9th Annual Lebowski Fest in Louisville, KY. This year I went solo and arrived a little early with Tom to enjoy the city a bit. As usual there were great costumes, great events, great food, and I was able to meet and reunite with many Achievers. We have more Fest coverage coming up so stay tuned.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Review of the 9th Annual Lebowski Fest

item.title: Episode 41 - Dudesong
item.description: This month I talked with Dudesong's creator, Phil Wells, via Skype. This episode is a few weeks late, but we'll be doubling up next month to make up for it. If you're coming to Lebowski Fest in Louisville please find us and say hello. We're organizing a meetup and will post details on our blog.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Phil Wells, author of Dudesong.

item.title: Episode 40 - Health Care Debate
item.description:
Since President Obama was elected into office as the 44th president of the United States of America, he has been pushing for Congress to enact health care reform for the American people. In March of 2010, a health care reform bill (H.R. 4872) was passed by a narrow margin. Leading up to this historic vote and after, there have been many heated discussions and debates over the value and even legality of this new legislation. This month we tried to understand this issue by discussing it through the characters of The Big Lebowski.
We have a new segment titled Dude Thoughts with Tom where Tom Esterline "phones in" and chats about what's going on in his life. He shares some Dude dos and don'ts, along with ideas about how to best achieve at Achieverdom.
Tune in next month to hear our interview with Phill Wells who created Dudesong, an epic poem version of The Big Lebowski.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: In trying to understand the health care bill, we tried to see it through our favorite characters.

item.title: Episode 39 - Jeff Bridges Tribute
item.description: Jeff Bridges finally won an Academy Award and we felt the need to celebrate. TJ and Larry joined us to talk about Jeff Bridges' life, career, and some of his films other than The Big Lebowski. In a new segment we relate a real life "Dude story" from one of our listeners. Join us next month as we'll be discussing health care reform and how that might affect the The Dude, Walter and Donny.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we celebrate Jeff Bridges' career.

Join us next month as we'll be discussing health care reform and how that might affect the The Dude, Walter and Donny.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, Jeff Bridges, Fearless,Contender,Fabulous Baker Boys,Arlington Road,White Squall,Amateurs,Fisher King,Crazy Heart,Starman,TRON

item.title: Episode 38 - LebowskiPalooza
item.description: March 6, 2010 marks LebowskiPalooza, the biggest Lebowski event in Canada. I had a great time interviewing two of its organizers. They even graciously stood by while we troubleshot an echo problem. This even coincides with Day of The Dude - Dudeism's Dude holiday and don't forget to cheer Jeff Bridges on to his first Oscar win on March 7th.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with LebowskiPalooza's organizers

item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, LebowskiPalooza,Canada,event,Day of The Dude

item.title: Episode 37 - Two Gentlemen of Lebowski
item.description: In January of 2010, Adam Bertocci released his Shakespearean-themed translation of The Big Lebowski script. We were able to get him on the phone for an interview and talk about how his project came about. It's something that really exploded on the internet and there are now readings and productions being planned all across the US. There might even be a book deal in the works. For February we're hoping to talk with Rev Dom and his crew who are working on a Dudeism documentary.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Adam Bertocci, creator of Two Gentlemen of Lebowski.

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, Adam Bertocci, Shakespeare, translation

item.title: Episode 36 - Fargo
item.description: TJ and Larry came back for another episode to discuss Fargo, the Coen Brothers' first Oscar winner. Contest winners announced and round 2 of contest in January. Happy holidays.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Fargo Review

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, Fargo, Coen Brothers

item.title: Episode 35 - Sy Ableman
item.description: Fred Melamed played the character of Sy Ableman in the most recent Coen Brother film, A Serious Man. In our interview with Fred we heard his first-hand experiences working with the Coen Brothers, some ins and outs of the film industry and what it was like on the set of A Serious Man. Check out Bill Green's new art show, Jaffe and Comentale's new book The Year's Work in Lebowski Studies, and be sure to enter our contest to win a Liam bowling ball shammy.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: We interviewed Sy Ableman (Fred Melamed) from the new Coen flick, A Serious Man.

item.title: Liam Shammy
item.description: On November 25th, a new item will be available from the Lebowski Fest store. Listen to my interview with Jim "Liam O'Brien" Hoosier to find out about his new, officially endorsed, piece of bowling equipment. Tune in to Episode 35 for details on how you can win one.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Episode 34 - The Achievers Review
item.description: Eddie Chung's documentary, The Achievers, is finally available for purchase! Larry, TJ, Liz and I sat down to talk about our thoughts on Lebowski Fest and the documentary. Prof Tim won our final item from Entertainment Earth. Keep your eyes peeled for a new Liam item from Lebowski Fest. Later this month tune in for our interview with Fred "Sy Ableman" Melamed from A Serious Man.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Episode 33 - Lebowski Fest Boston
item.description: Lebowski Fest came to Boston this month. Liz and I hung out with the fest staff and recorded our conversation. Next month we'll review the documentary The Achievers and give away a Dude action figure.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Lebowski Fest came to Boston this month. Liz and I hung out with the fest staff and recorded our conversation. Next month we'll review the documentary The Achievers and give away a Dude action figure.
item.itunes:summary: Lebowski Fest came to Boston this month. Liz and I hung out with the Will, Scott, Tom, Dave and Roli back in the green room at the House of Blues. Here's some of that conversation and all of the "inside stories" from the Speed of Sound Tour. Next month we'll review the documentary The Achievers and give away a Dude action figure. This month's winner of a Maude bobble head was Carolyn "dudeabides" from Vermont.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, contest, Entertainment Earth, action figure, Boston, house of blues, bowling, festival

item.title: Episode 32 - Falsani Abides
item.description: In October you'll have the chance to by the next great Lebowski book to hit the market - The Dude Abides: The Gospel According to the Coen Brothers by Cathleen Falsani. We were able to chat with Falsani via bag-phone and got a chance to talk with the book's well-known illustrator Erik Rose. Tim from Indiana won himself a Walter action figure. Next month is Boston Fest and we're giving away a Maude bobble head.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Review of The Dude Abides: The Gospel According to the Coen Brothers

item.title: The Dude Hates Cancer
item.description: The Dude Hates Cancer is an annual bowling fund raiser bringing awareness to Leukemia and Lymphoma. You can catch this year's event August 22 in Philadelphia.

item.description: This month is basically news and updates as we're gearing up for the 8th Annual Lebowski Fest. We've partnered up with Entertainment Earth and will be giving away some of their merchandise each month starting in July.

item.title: Episode 29 - Dax Norman
item.description: Dax Norman is an artist and an Achiever. You might have seen his Lebowski-themed bowling pins at the 2008 San Francisco Lebowski Fest. Will Russell called in with an update about the Speed of Sound Tour and Liz is starting an online writing class. See our site for more info - http://tinyurl.com/kpoj6m
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Episode 28 - Losing Friends with Bridges and Pegg
item.description: Chalupa's sister decided to spend her spring break in the fabled lands of New Hampshire. While she was here I got her to finally watch The Big Lebowski. Afterwards we reviewed How to Lose Friends and Alienate People, a Jeff Bridges/Simon Pegg film that was recently released on DVD. Having problems with the iTunes store. Please help us direct listeners to our website if they want to subscribe. For more info - http://tinyurl.com/dyvagx
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: How to Lose Friends and Alienate People review.

item.title: Episode 27a - Steven Levy on Technology

April's episode on How To Lose Friends and Alienate People. See web site for more info - http://tinyurl.com/d7bcag

item.title: Episode 27 - Steven Levy's Wish List
item.description: Steven Levy wished for a sequel to The Big Lebowski. It hasn't arrived yet, but he was willing to talk to us via the bag phone about his love for the film and his experience with the Coen Brothers. We've joined Twitter and Andrea Dudette was our featured listener. See http://tinyurl.com/dly94e for more info.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Episode 26 - Talk after watching
item.description: This month we review Burn After Reading (2008), the Coens most recent film. Please rate us on iTunes and help us get onto Wikipedia. If you helped spread the word about the podcast, let us know and we'll give you some recognition. Next month interviews with famous Lebowski fans. See our web site for more info - http://lebowskipodcast.com/index.php/Episodes/Episode-26-Talk-after-watching.html

item.title: Episode 25 - Pineapple Express
item.description: Episode 25 heralds our 2nd anniversary and the start to another year of podcasting. This month we discuss the film Pineapple Express as a stoner film and some similarities we found between it and The Big Lebowski. Tom joined us as a guest this episode. We're reading listener emails again and have a new feature, Listener Spotlights, highlighting our listeners. See our web site for more info - http://lebowskipodcast.com/index.php/Episodes/Episode-25-Pineapple-Express.html.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Pineapple Express - stoner film review and theories on Dude and Walter's past.

item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, Pineapple Express, spotlight, theory

item.title: Episode 24 - Money
item.description: Please welcome our first New Hampshire guest, Bryan Parys. This month we talked about how money drives some characters and affects others. Read more about this subject on Chalupa's column at Dudespaper. Second anniversary contest to win an autographed copy of I'm a Lebowski, You're a Lebowski. Happy holidays and safe travels to all. See you next year. Email any comments and questions to lebowskipodcast@gmail.com
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Money: How it affects and drives the characters in The Big Lebowski.

item.title: Tom's NYC Fest Review
item.description: Tom, aka The Dude, reports on the NYC Lebowski Fest and his experience in New York city. Tom is our Lebowski Fest Correspondent and reports on all the ins and outs of the festivals along with a review on the city it's held in. Chalupa has started writing a column at http://dudespaper.com. January will be our 2nd anniversary. The 10th person to purchase a shirt will win a copy of I'm a Lebowski, You're a Lebowski autographed by Will Russell and Scott Shuffitt. Details at the end of the podcast. Links and other info at http://lebowskipodcast.com
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Tom, our Lebowski Fest correspondent reports on the New York festival.

item.title: Episode 23 - DVD Achiever Edition
item.description: Chalupa and Liz review the Achiever Edition DVD of The Big Lebowski. We're looking for guest speakers. Tom's NY Fest review coming soon. Check out www.dudespaper.com. Chalupa has a column, Notes on the Cycle, there.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalupa and Liz review the Achiever Edition DVD of The Big Lebowski.
item.itunes:summary:
Chalupa and Liz review the Achiever Edition DVD (released September 2008) and the special features, and the bowling ball packaging. Bowling tip from Tom. Tom's NY Fest review coming soon.
Check out www.dudespaper.com. Chalupa is writing the "Notes on the Cycle" column. Still plenty of time to get Lebowski Podcast merchandise and Dax Norman bowling pins before Christmas.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Big Lebowski, DVD, Achiever, Edition, review, special features, commentary

item.title: Episode 22 - Actor Update
item.description: The actors and actresses of The Big Lebowski have a long list of good films they've been working on. We also share some answers to "Why Lebowski?"

item.title: Episode 17 - Achiever Etiquette
item.description:
Part 1: We took a trip down to Tom's house for a chat with him and Brad about Achiever Etiquette. As a bonus, he also showed us his Lebowski shrine and we rolled a game afterwards.
Part 2: I gave Daniel, from Everthus the Deadbeats, a call and learned all about his band, their upcoming tour, and their upcoming performance at the 7th Annual Lebowski Fest. Daniel also lent us some tunes for the episode. Check these guys out.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Achiever etiquette with Tom and Brad along with an interview with Daniel from Everthus The Deadbeats.

item.title: Episode 16 - Film Technicalities
item.description: Joe Blevins hopped a bus to Indianapolis to talk with us about cinematography, set design, and costume design. We recorded in a downtown mall and were heckled by some teenagers. Luckily we were calmer than they were.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Houston Lebowski Bash
item.description: Jason is setting up a *FREE* Lebowski event this summer in Houston, TX. If you have nothing to do on June 21st, you need to swing by and tell them Chalupa from the Lebowski Podcast sent you. Jason is still in need of volunteers, bands, and even some flooring to complete his bowling alley. Check out their site.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.title: Jeff Bridges Q&A at Dallas Angelika
item.description: Dan Prall, aka Walter LaFester, went to the Dallas Angelika a few weeks ago to see The Amateurs and attended the Q&A afterwards with Jeff Bridges. Dan asked the question on everyone's mind and Bridges even called him Walter! Today is also Dan's birthday so wish him a good one.

item.itunes:keywords: Jeff Bridges, The Amateurs, Dan Prall

item.title: Episode 12 - Dudeism
item.description: Dr. James Spiegel helped us take a close look at the Dudeism movement and analyze it philosophically. Modern day Dudeists also discussed. Mic troubles on some of the audio. Next month we're talking to the founding dudes.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr. James Spiegel on Dudeism
item.itunes:summary: Dr. James Spiegel helped us take a close look at the Dudeism movement and analyze it philosophically. Modern day Dudeists also discussed. Mic troubles on some of the audio. Next month we're talking to the founding dudes.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Dudeism, James Spiegel, philosophy, religion, Oliver Benjamin

item.title: Episode 11 - Lebowski Fan Book
item.description: After we all finished reading I'm a Lebowski, You're a Lebowski we decided there needed to be an episode. Co-written by the Festival dudes and two other achievers, this is the ultimate fan book. New Coen movie out in theaters and next month - Dudeism!
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: I'm a Lebowski, You're a Lebowski

item.itunes:keywords: Will Russell, Scott Shuffitt, Bill Green, Ben Peskoe

item.title: Episode 10 - The Contender
item.description: We watched The Contender (2000), starring Jeff Bridges and Sam Elliot, and compared the movie against The Big Lebowski. Major format changes this month. Let us know what we should ask the Founding Dudes in our interview in January.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Review of The Contender

item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: The Contender, Jeff Bridges, Sam Elliot

item.title: Episode 9 - Donny Tribute
item.description: The fans asked for it and the fans got it - a tribute to Theodore Donald Karabotsos. Neville Kiser, our Lebowski Ambassador to China, was in as our guest speaker along with Sevier. Chalupa and Gunner unveiled their Donny-theories. Joe Blevins educated us on average shot length and we had some good emails as usual.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Donny Tribute with Neville and Sevier

item.title: Episode 8 - Uli Kunkel Edition
item.description: This month was dedicated to Peter Stormare, also known as Uli Kunkel and Karl Hungus, and the many other things he has been involved in. Due to many unforeseen events, Liz and Chalupa were the only two involved this month. Lots of changes to the website. New Lebowski book is now available. Donny tribute in September.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Peter Stormare

item.title: Episode 7 - Lebowski Culture
item.description: This month Lofton came back to help us discuss Lebowski culture from his new penthouse loft. This includes merchandise, catch phrases, art, literature, fan sites, etc. Any place you see references to The Big Lebowski in pop-culture. Another story from Sloppy Joe along with a new and improved trivia section.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Lebowski culture with Tim Lofton

item.itunes:keywords: Tim Lofton, culture, merchandise, art, literature, phrases

item.title: Luke Rushing interview
item.description: We were originally hoping to talk to Luke before we recorded the podcast, but some scheduling conflicts occurred. Luke gave us his thoughts on the soundtrack and other music in the movie. Luke had some interesting insider information about how Captain Beefheart recorded their albums. We theorized why the Dude hates The Eagles so much and discussed the trivia question.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Soundtrack with Luke Rushing

item.itunes:keywords: Luke Rushing, soundtrack, Captain Beefheart

item.title: Episode 6 - Soundtrack and T-Bone Burnett
item.description: This month we discussed the soundtrack and the amazing T-Bone Burnett. Tim Lofton came in as our guest and educated us on music, life and other things. RSS feed is being changed. Check the website for more details and our first hate-mail. Lebowski Fest next month.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Soundtrack and T-Bone Burnett with Tim Lofton

item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Tim Lofton, T-Bone Burnett, soundtrack

item.title: Episode 5 - Film Noir
item.description: Episode 5 was the month of technical difficulties. A big thanks to Robby Tompkins for coming in and educating us on film noir. We talked about the history of this film genre and style, found ways to spot one, and then discussed examples in the film. New book coming out - I'm a Lebowski, You're a Lebowski. Next month we'll be connecting with Luke via web cam to get his thoughts on the soundtrack.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)
item.itunes:subtitle: Film Noir discussion
item.itunes:summary: Episode 5 was the month of technical difficulties. A big thanks to Robby Tompkins for coming in and educating us on film noir. We talked about the history of this film genre and style, found ways to spot one, and then discussed examples in the film. New book coming out - I'm a Lebowski, You're a Lebowski. Next month we'll be connecting with Luke via web cam to get his thoughts on the soundtrack.
item.itunes:author: Lebowski Podcast
item.itunes:keywords: Film Noir, Robby Tompkins

item.title: Episode 4 - Women in the film: A Feminist Critique
item.description: We're back with the long awaited episode going in depth on the women of the film. Liz and Dr. Beulah Baker graced us with both their presence and their expertise while helping us do a feminist critique of the film. Our website went online this week.
item.author: lebowskipodcast@gmail.com (Chalupa and Liz)

item.itunes:keywords: Feminism, Beulah Baker
